newsitem.title: TURKEY: Turkish shares ease, end above lows.
newsitem.headline: Turkish shares ease, end above lows.

text.p: Istanbul shares shed an average 0.52 percent in thin, quiet trading on Monday, but ended above the day's lows, brokers said.
The IMKB-100 closed at 93,917.28, down 489.94 points from Friday's all-time high of 94,407.22. It sank to a low of 92,707 before rebounding.
Trade volume dived to 12.20 trillion lira from 17.68 trillion lira on Friday.
"Sellers take to the sidelines when prices fall, that is why volume shrank," said Hakan Demirbulak from Tatbank.

Several brokers said the uptrend remained intact although trade range was squeezed after the recent gains. The index leapt 2.89 percent last week after a 5.49 percent surge the previous week and hit nine record closes in the last two weeks.
"There is no strong selling because the uptrend is still valid. The market takes a rest by lowering volume," said Ali Guler from Acar securities.
"There is a need for new locomotive shares other than the state owned firms which recently rallied on privatisation expectations," he added.

Of the 231 shares traded, losers outdid gainers by 104 to 65 and 62 were unchanged. The 85-share industrial index eased 0.29 percent to 98,727.20 and the 15-share financial index fell 1.01 percent to 91,910.47.

Actives were led by largely state owned flat steel producer Eregli and T.Isbank's C series, both steady at 13,250 and 17,750 lira, respectively and utility Aktas Elektrik, up 3,000 lira at 87,000. Together, they made up 17 percent of the total volume.
